description: Alterations to the shop frontage, replacement of existing condenser units and new louvre openings to the rear of the property at ground floor level.

phasing_details.phase_detail: Phase 1- Building will be completed as one phase

constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: AIRCZ Type:: Heathrow Planning Consultation Zone: All buildings, structures, erections and works exceeding 90 metres in height (295.3 feet)Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Heathrow Airport Limited, c/o Planning Services, First Point, Buckingham Gate, Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH6 0NT

decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The development to which this permission relates shall be carried out in accordance with the materials specified on the approved plans and on the submitted application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with Policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and Policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to the commencement of the development to which this permission relates, an acoustic report shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The report shall assess the existing acoustic climate at the site and its potential to affect future occupants of the development. The following sources of noise and vibration shall be considered:- Condenser units- Any other plant proposedIf the assessment indicates that noise from these sources is likely to affect occupants, the report shall detail mitigation measures designed so that nuisance will not be caused to them.The report shall be authored by a suitably qualified acoustic consultant/engineer and shall take into account the provisions of BS 8233:2014 "Guidance on sound insulation and noise reduction for buildings".The approved mitigation measures shall be implemented prior to beneficial occupation of the development and be permanently retained thereafter.Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for the occupants of the development, in accordance with policy D14 of the London Plan 2021 policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.These details are required prior to commencement of development because the relevant works would take place at the beginning of the construction phase and the details are likely to affect the design of other elements of the scheme.
